Posts.Content: Lisa40 wrote: I finished whole brain rads about 5 weeks ago. My ? is ever since I had radiation I've had headaches. I didn't have them before but I wake up with one everyday. It isn't a horrible headache but still annoying. Just wondering if anyone else is experiencing this and what dr. has said. Mine doesn't seem concerned at all. Also am still really tired and am still on anti seizure meds. How long has your dr. kept you on meds? I'm thinking it is indefinitely but am wondering if anyone has better luck with meds and sleepiness? Thanks. Lisa Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2007 02:51PM Lisa40 wrote: Karilynn, I am absolutely amazed at your positive attitude!  All I seem to be doing is crying lately.  My dad had colon cancer removed a few weeks ago.  He is doing fine but I'm a mess.  I am going through the emotions I went through ininitially.  I'm a mess and trying to except my stage 4 brain saga but am still holding onto hope.  Anyway I admire you and the fact that you never complain and continue to march on as if notihing is out of the normal.  I haven't had hair now for a year.  I gave up the itchy wig and am bald unless it is cold outside.  I hate that you are going through this!  Hang in ther and fists up. Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2007 08:34AM Lisa40 wrote: Jacqniel,  I hate cancer!  It is as plan and simple as that.  It sneaks up on you when you are feeling well and you can forget about it for awhile.  I've been suffering from this since the beginning.  Feeling fine then boom..  This is just a bump in the road.  My older brother is going through something similar.  His enzymes are out of control.  They thought his Hodgkin's had returned but biopsy showed scar tissue in liver.  They are trying to figure it out and thinking it is from all the medicine he has been on for the last 20 years.  I guess it isn't always what they think it is.  So hang in there, rest, and keep your fists up to kick butt! Lisa

Posts.Content: Lisa40 wrote: I'm trying my best not to think about it but I can't help it.  The fact that my brain mets are progressing after 3 months can't be good.  I'm worried about more radiation.  Today is my babies 5th bday.  I was diagnosed when he was 2.  It is hard for me to look at him and wonder how much longer.  Actually all my kids.  My head hurts which is probably from sinuses but every little miss step, headache etc. I'm thinking cancer.  Does anyone know any positive stories of brain mets with multiple lesions that didn't respond to wbr the first time and are did the second and surviving more than 9 months?  Thanks., Lisa Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Lisa40 wrote: I have a girlfriend that was diagnosed a year after I was. We both had 8 cm tumors with node involvement. Pretty much the same treatment except she was er+/pr+. A year latter and her PET came back showing the cancer had spread to her bones, blood and somewhere else. Her doctor has pretty much said she should look into trials and there wasn't much more she could do for her. I'm confused! Why is she untreatable with all the newer drugs? Any ideas? I'd appreciate any suggestions as far as drug combos, etc. It breaks my heart! She is a young mother in her 30's with 4 very young children. I'm having a hard time wrapping my brain around this! Thanks. Lisa Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Any suggestions? Lisa40 joanne1428

Posts.Content: Lisa40 wrote: I'm tired of cancer dictating me and my family!  For those that remember my mom had a biopsy came back noncancerous, they are still confused about my brother but it isn't cancer...my dad had a routine colonoscopy and they found a 5 cm polyp biopsied and they said it was precancerous.  Then after surgery Dr. said his educated guess is that it is cancer and took nodes as well.  I have faith that he will be fine but am tired of it.  I feel like I opened up  pandora's box when I filled out the papers for genetic testing.  My family believed it or not has been pretty healthy until I was diagnosed... I'm angrrrrry!  If you could say a prayer for my father, Richard, along with the many other prayers for all our sisters I'd appreciate it!  Lisa Log in to post a reply
